intro: Euphorbia amygdaloides subsp. amygdaloides, commonly known as the smooth tree spurge, is a shrub-like plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features a woody stem with a smooth, grayish bark and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. The plant has a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its structure and appearance make it a distinctive and hardy plant in arid environments.
